displaytitle: The Most Beautiful Part of a Man's Body
medium: Gelatin silver print with handwritten text
creditline: Bequest of Duane E. Wilder, Class of 1951

titles.title: The Most Beautiful Part of a Man's Body

makers.displaydate: born 1932, McKeesport, PA; active New York, NY
makers.displaymaker: Duane Michals, born 1932, McKeesport, PA; active New York, NY

texts.textentryhtml:
Seeing deeply what is in front of you is at the heart of Michals’s work. When he started writing on his photographs, it was his attempt to go beyond the image. “I had to write about all the things you couldn’t see,” he said. “The artist has to make a leap of faith to insight, otherwise it’s just description.”


The text reads: “I think it must be there / Where the torso sits on and into the hips / Those twin delineating curves / Feminine in grace, girdling the trunk / Guiding the eye downwards / To their intersection / the point of pleasure.”
texts.remarks: The Eclectic Eye: A Tribute to Duane Wilder

texts.textentryhtml: The artist. Acquired by Duane E. Wilder (1929-2017); bequeathed to the Princeton University Art Museum, 2018.
